intro: Barbosella orbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular barbosella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Angola. The plant is characterized by its spherical, fleshy stems that store water, adapting it to its harsh environment. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters and are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and beetles. Barbosella orbicularis is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to drought and extreme temperatures.
